questions.question: A person whose mass is 100 kg travels from Earth to Mars in a spaceship. Neglect all  other objects in sky and take acceleration due to gravity on the surface of the Earth and Mars as 10 m/s^{2} and 4 m/s^{2} respectively. Identify from the below figures, the curve that fits best for the weight of the passenger as a function of time.

questions.question_text: The value of tension in a long thin metal wire has been changed from T1 to T2. The lengths of the metal wire at two different values of tension T1 and T2 are l1 and l2 respectively. The actual length of the metal wire is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The value of tension in a long thin metal wire has been changed from T_{1} to T_{2}. The lengths of the metal wire at two different values of tension T_{1} and T_{2} are l_{1} and l_{2} respectively. The actual length of the metal wire is :

questions.question_text: A body having specific charge 8 $$\mu$$C/g is resting on a frictionless plane at a distance 10 cm from the wall (as shown in the figure). It starts moving towards the wall when a uniform electric field of 100 V/m is applied horizontally towards the wall. If the collision of the body with the wall is perfectly elastic, then the time period of the motion will be _______________ s.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A body having specific charge 8 $$\mu$$C/g is resting on a frictionless plane at a distance 10 cm from the wall (as shown in the figure). It starts moving towards the wall when a uniform electric field of 100 V/m is applied horizontally towards the wall. If the collision of the body with the wall is perfectly elastic, then the time period of the motion will be _______________ s.

questions.question_text: In a spring gun having spring constant 100 N/m a small ball 'B' of mass 100 g is put in its barrel (as shown in figure) by compressing the spring through 0.05 m. There should be a box placed at a distance 'd' on the ground so that the ball falls in it. If the ball leaves the gun horizontally at a height of 2 m above the ground. The value of d is _________ m. (g = 10 m/s2).
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In a spring gun having spring constant 100 N/m a small ball 'B' of mass 100 g is put in its barrel (as shown in figure) by compressing the spring through 0.05 m. There should be a box placed at a distance 'd' on the ground so that the ball falls in it. If the ball leaves the gun horizontally at a height of 2 m above the ground. The value of d is _________ m. (g = 10 m/s^{2}).

questions.question_text: An object viewed from a near point distance of 25 cm, using a microscopic lens with magnification '6', gives an unresolved image. A resolved image is observed at infinite distance with a total magnification double the earlier using an eyepiece along with the given lens and a tube of length 0.6 m, if the focal length of the eyepiece is equal to __________ cm.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: An object viewed from a near point distance of 25 cm, using a microscopic lens with magnification '6', gives an unresolved image. A resolved image is observed at infinite distance with a total magnification double the earlier using an eyepiece along with the given lens and a tube of length 0.6 m, if the focal length of the eyepiece is equal to __________ cm.

questions.question_text: A circular disc reaches from top to bottom of an inclined plane of length 'L'. When it slips down the plane, it makes time 't1'. When it rolls down the plane, it takes time t2. The value of $${{{t_2}} \over {{t_1}}}$$ is $$\sqrt {{3 \over x}} $$. The value of x will be _______________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A circular disc reaches from top to bottom of an inclined plane of length 'L'. When it slips down the plane, it makes time 't_{1}'. When it rolls down the plane, it takes time t_{2}. The value of $${{{t_2}} \over {{t_1}}}$$ is $$\sqrt {{3 \over x}} $$. The value of x will be _______________.

questions.question_text: The amplitude of wave disturbance propagating in the positive x-direction is given by $$y = {1 \over {{{(1 + x)}^2}}}$$ at time t = 0 and $$y = {1 \over {1 + {{(x - 2)}^2}}}$$ at t = 1 s, where x and y are in metres. The shape of wave does not change during the propagation. The velocity of the wave will be ___________ m/s.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The amplitude of wave disturbance propagating in the positive x-direction is given by $$y = {1 \over {{{(1 + x)}^2}}}$$ at time t = 0 and $$y = {1 \over {1 + {{(x - 2)}^2}}}$$ at t = 1 s, where x and y are in metres. The shape of wave does not change during the propagation. The velocity of the wave will be ___________ m/s.

questions.question_text: In an LCR series circuit, an inductor 30 mH and a resistor 1 $$\Omega$$ are connected to an AC source of angular frequency 300 rad/s. The value of capacitance for which, the current leads the voltage by 45$$^\circ$$ is $${1 \over x} \times {10^{ - 3}}$$ F. Then the value of x  is ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In an LCR series circuit, an inductor 30 mH and a resistor 1 $$\Omega$$ are connected to an AC source of angular frequency 300 rad/s. The value of capacitance for which, the current leads the voltage by 45$$^\circ$$ is $${1 \over x} \times {10^{ - 3}}$$ F. Then the value of x  is ____________.

questions.question_text: A rod of mass M and length L is lying on a horizontal frictionless surface. A particle of mass 'm' travelling along the surface hits at one end of the rod with a velocity 'u' in a direction perpendicular to the rod. The collision is completely elastic. After collision, particle comes to rest. The ratio of masses $$\left( {{m \over M}} \right)$$ is $${1 \over x}$$. The value of 'x' will be ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A rod of mass M and length L is lying on a horizontal frictionless surface. A particle of mass 'm' travelling along the surface hits at one end of the rod with a velocity 'u' in a direction perpendicular to the rod. The collision is completely elastic. After collision, particle comes to rest. The ratio of masses $$\left( {{m \over M}} \right)$$ is $${1 \over x}$$. The value of 'x' will be ____________.

questions.question_text: In the reported figure, heat energy absorbed by a system in going through a cyclic process is ___________ $$\pi$$J.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In the reported figure, heat energy absorbed by a system in going through a cyclic process is ___________ $$\pi$$J.
